text: Stephen M. Schwartz (January 1, 1942 â€“ March 17, 2020) was an American pathologist. He worked at the University of Washington. He researched vascular biology, investigating the structure of blood vessels and smooth muscle cells. Schwartz was an assistant professor of pathology from 1974 to 1979, an associate professor from 1979 to 1984, and then a full professor from 1984 until his death. Schwartz died of COVID-19 on March 17, 2020 in Seattle, Washington, aged 78. ==References== Category:1942 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Deaths from the COVID-19 pandemic in Washington (state) Category:University of Washington faculty Category:Medical researchers Category:Scientists from Washington (state) Category:Pathologists
title: Stephen Schwartz (pathologist)
